Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery kantharos; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below with two bands in added red; exterior: band in red below reserved top of rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of upper half of Hermes (face and neck in red), to right, wearing chiton and red mantle, holding his kerykeion vertically in his right hand; at right, part of large lotus in red; inscription in field.
Producer name: Attributed to the Manner of: The KX Painter
Curator's comments: Sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.753.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.16)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 256, no. 13)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 354, no. B450)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 227, no. 11 (a))
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0736) (Phase 1)
